alert.note: Alert for Hendricks (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 8:16PM EST until March 04 at 12:14PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Indiana, including the following counties, Hendricks, Johnson, Marion and Morgan. * WHEN...Until midnight EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of less than 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indianapolis, Carmel, Fishers, Greenwood, Lawrence, Plainfield, Franklin, Brownsburg, Beech Grove, Martinsville, Speedway, Mooresville, Danville, Southport, Avon, New Whiteland, Cumberland, Edinburgh, Whiteland and Bargersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
